intro: Sphaeralcea cordobensis, commonly known as the Cordoba globemallow, is a flowering plant native to Argentina. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, glandular leaves. It produces small, round fruits called capsules that contain numerous seeds. Sphaeralcea cordobensis is adapted to arid environments and is often found in steppes and shrublands.
